alert.note: Alert for Catawba; Davie; Iredell; Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 10 at 2:38AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CATAWBA...DAVIE...IREDELL AND WESTERN ROWAN COUNTIES THROUGH 330 AM EST... At 235 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from 8 miles north of Mocksville to 6 miles east of Newton. Movement was east at 25 mph. Some sleet was mixed in with the stronger showers, which might result in a light accumulation in some spots. Temperatures will remain well above freezing, however. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salisbury, Statesville, Mocksville, Newton, Conover, Spencer, Troutman, Bermuda Run, Claremont, and Cooleemee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
